reviewText:
1. Every level is unlocked from the start. No sense of progress. Unsatisfying.
2. Upon completion of a level, it CLOSES THE GAME AND RE-OPENS IT.
3. Unclear objectives. Sometimes you have to stand on platforms to open doors, sometimes you have to collect items, sometimes you have to kill enemies.
4. Useless radar in top left of screen. Absolutely useless.
5. When you get hit, the game lags for 2-3 seconds.
6. Awful color/theme/style. No consistency, can't see where you are half the time.
7. Horrible controls. Scrolling the mouse wheel ascends/descends you when you are a helicopter. 'Nuff said.

I had more fun writing this review than I did playing the game. Don't waste your time with this game. Stay way clear of it.

reviewText:
I can't really give this a fair review. I love FPS games, I never feel sick playing games from motion issues or otherwise.

This game made me feel queasy.

Seems like it could be interesting if it wasn't so .... gross.

Whomever designed the color scheme and graphics must have been severely colorblind.... and I'm colorblind... that's telling you something right there.

Further, there is no settings menu in game to control things like music or sound level... but the menu that is there loves to jump around when you try to select things.... like someone discovered what they thought would be a good idea, but seriously... just annoying.

Overall: 2/10 - Stay away or puke

reviewText:
CARDS AND BADGES PLOX

This game kinda sucks, but the author should consider this as a learning opportunity.

Also the author BETTER - MUST - NEEDS TO - add some damn cards! At least make this game a little more valuable please!

SOME DAMN BADGES AND CARDS - Please :)

If it had cards, it would be a neutral review instead of negative.

So here it goes.

Pros

* Could be worse
* More than one game type
* More than one weapon
* More than one mode of movement
* First and Third Person
* Not expensive
* On Steam
* Won for free on a website, you can too!

Cons

* Sound does not work, echoes a lot and skips
* Horrible graphics
* Bad UI, Buggy
* NO OPTIONS MENU!? (The worst crime a game can commit)
* Not too fun after about 2 minutes
* No control change
* No controller support
* No steam cards
* No steam badges
* No Achievments
* No Leaderboards
* No DLC
* Repetitive
* While cheap, too much money still for what you get
* Awful menu
* Game resets every time you end a game, lose a game, win a game
* Only a few weapons
* Weapon charge is not explained
* No tutorial
* Not a lot of people like this game
* Not updated ever
* Bad color scheme
* No graphical consistency
* Confusing
* No sense of direction or goals
* No real story to see

reviewText:
short review:
its fun game for 2 dollars, mindless arcade fun with a cheesy anime plot, with some messy menus and Hud
Long review:
this reminds me of a game that I would rent from Blockbuster For my N64, buy it later, I would think its the best game ever, then fast forward today, where I would dust it off  and play it and be like whoah this was really fun, then I look up reviews on it and Reviews would be like
~bad control, ugly polygons,bad music in comparsion to today gameing standards~
~IGN- too many polygons 3/10~
I mean lets get this outta of the way
Cons
-the menus are ugly
-the ingame hud overlaps each other
-when I hit escape , fail/mission it goes to my desktop and resets the entire game
but despite that
the controls are not that bad
the music is heavly based on Kota Hoshino work on Armored core
The game is quite similar to alot of other works because of the transforming mechanic, which means it has alot of varatiy and intreasting mechanics
and the little voice acting in it, is really bad, like 80s anime bad, where its enjoyable , each mission is broken up (with 36 in tottal) and you can see how the story would have unfolded
and finaly the polygons is quite colorful and vivid, and quite nice to look at
For 2 dollars, your getting a silly mindless action game, its a good time waster

reviewText: I did have fun playing this game, which is the point of a game. I didn't really play that much, but it seems like a fun game. It isn't professionaly made or anything really, just... game on Steam. It is worth the $2, and it isn't that bad of a game. After 4 edits I think I finally made had enough time to make a somewhat professional review. At first I thought this was a horrible game, but after actually sitting down and writing an actual review... it seems like a decent game. The developer seems like a pretty honest and active person, and I like that. The game seems inspired by the game 'Armored Core' ... and it is.\n\nWelp time to edit this 7 or so more times...

reviewText:
Spheroid is product of a fan of the Armored Core series by FROM SOFTWARE. Spheroid is like the original Armored Core from original PlayStation in concept, but without providing any form of customization and adding in a few unique changes that make it feel more like a blend between Armored Core and Transformers BeastMachines. The music used in the preview was created in similararity to music from Armored Core Nexus. Not sure if Frame Gride or Murakumo Mech Assalt were also inspiration in the design or if I'm entirely wrng and its VirtualOn in the mix.

Why do I not recommend this? Mainly it is the lack of controller support, the fact that the menus are weird, and the game appears to do a full reset after completing a mission".

It doesn't seem terrible
date: just it seems like I paid for a fairly polished preview that will hopefully fund the next (improved) version -which is what FROM SOFTWARE did every console game on PS1 into the last title for PS2. Every game was playable
hoursPlayed: or had implemented entirely new concept dynamics from previous that were not fully tested and ironed out for any kind of balance
voteText: etc.\n\nI can't say enough how its the lack of controller support that is the main reason I can not recommend this."

reviewText: Great game! Lots of levels. Some are really hard, and some are really easy (I'm looking at you, Razor). The gameplay is great, I love the resemblance to Metroid, and the heroes have cool, unique abilities. And this is all for 2 bucks! Hours of gameplay (even more when you try to beat the levels on hardcore mode) at a great price!

reviewText:
Well, I deleted my review. I thought you know if I could make a wise crack. Be a little bit of a jerk, I knew I couldn't do any better. Guess that's what happens when you are on the internet. You get people thinking you actually don't know what windows 8, or what an i7 core is. Don't get me wrong, This game has major potential, and I thought I poked a little bit of innocent fun. But I guess not.

So without further ado,(since my satire is not welcome here) let me write a serious and heartfelt review.
Don't let my previous review keep you from buying this game, it could be great, but right now it is pretty buggy.
The graphics are simplistic but hard to use to spot enemies. There are no options menus and I think if he gets enough sales he should remake it on a better engine. There are no checkpoints and whenever you die you restart the whole program that is the game. Some features are not actually stated, like the way you fly in the second level. No apparent plot and bad voice acting. Weird doppelganger bots randomly walk around. Ai is impeccable at shooting you and there are no healing stations.

To be honest, I thought this looked like one of my favorite childhood games: Custom robo. But it wasn't.

Remorse-over-previous-review/10  (couldn't have zero satire)
